Legal_Issue: Whether the citizenship judge erred by strictly applying the physical presence test for residency, excluding the qualitative residency test under ss 5(1)(c) of the Citizenship Act
Application_Facts: Dr. El Ocla was absent due to professional obligations but maintained strong ties to Canada
Remedy_Requested: Redetermination of Dr. El Ocla's application by another citizenship judge
Court_Ruling: The citizenship judge applied only the physical presence test, ignoring the qualitative standard
Defendant_Behavior: Citizenship judge applied a strict physical presence test without considering qualitative residency factors
Grounds_for_Claim: Exclusion of qualitative residency test despite maintained significant ties to Canada
Legal_Standard: Physical presence requirement of 1095 days in four years; qualitative residency test under s 5(1)(c)
Assessment_Factor: Centralization of mode of living in Canada
Procedural_Issue: Appeal under s 14(5) of the Citizenship Act
Evidence_Used: Professional obligations causing absence, maintained ties to Canada
Legal_Provision_Cited: s 5(1)(c), s 14(5) of the Citizenship Act
Evidence_Assessed: Nature and extent of ties to Canada
Relief_Sought: Allowance of appeal and reassessment of application
Governing_Rule: Applicants must meet physical presence or demonstrate qualitative residency by centralizing life in Canada
Evidentiary_Deficiency: Failure to consider evidence of qualitative residency
Outcome: Appeal succeeded; case remitted for redetermination
Harm_Assessment: Unfair denial of citizenship application due to narrow interpretation of residency
Cause_Description: Dr. El Ocla's citizenship application was rejected for not meeting the physical presence requirement despite maintaining significant ties to Canada
Evidence_Handling: Qualitative evidence of residency was not properly considered
Evidence_Issues: Relevant evidence of residency ties was overlooked
Residency_Compliance: Not met under physical test; potential compliance under qualitative test
Evidence_Assessment: Insufficient consideration of non-physical residency indicators
Decision_Rationale: Both physical and qualitative residency tests must be considered in assessing eligibility
Evidentiary_Issues: Failure to evaluate all relevant evidence on residency
Legal_Standard_Applied: Physical presence test under Citizenship Act
